subject: Re: Testing Getters and Setters - Achieving near-100% code coverage
msgSnippet: Elliotte Harold  wrote: But aside from a few weird cases like that, all code should be tested or deleted. ... in, say, ... really ... [MDT] This
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold <elharo@m...> wrote:

But aside from a few weird cases like that, all code should be
tested or deleted.

"J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:

> I don't mind it. I don't even mind Elliotte disagreeing with me
in, say,
> one of his articles. :) He obviously feels the ROI for testing
really
> simple code (get/set) to be higher than I do.

[MDT] This ROI issue seems pertinent to the discussion. I'm very
interested in any reactions to the Verification Facilitator style of
Unit Testing "simple code".

http://sourceforge.net/projects/testutil/
